remarks.format:
## Remarks Most practical <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> derived classes in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] are also a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> derived class. For these classes, the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement.Parent%2A> property should be used instead.
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement.Parent%2A> returns the parent element in the logical tree, which might not be the same element as returned by <xref:System.Windows.ContentOperations.GetParent%2A>. <xref:System.Windows.ContentOperations.GetParent%2A> exists specifically to correct for certain architectural issues whereby a <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> class that is not also a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> exists in a tree that is not strictly speaking either the logical tree or the visual tree.
